Dr Pratik Bhandari is the founder and Director of Research C4R.
He is an interdisciplinary researcher with over a decade of experience and expertise in
cognitive neuroscience, psycholinguistics, and speech and hearing sciences.
He also has a keen interest in studying the effects of rising global temperature and extreme weather events
on people's livelihoods in the developing and least developed countries like Nepal.

## Sajana Aryal

Sajana Aryal is a Research Associate at NCCS. Her research focuses on subclinical auditory damage, particularly the significance of extended high-frequency hearing and its implications for speech perception and neurophysiological processing. She is motivated to understand how early auditory damage influences neural mechanisms and perceptual outcomes, shaping broader implications for hearing health. She is a doctoral student at the University of Texas at Austin.
